title: Keen Community Remix Project
content:
This was mentioned during the topic about my remixes, but I think it should be semi-officially announced now. The basic idea is to remix every BGM track from Commander Keen: Goodbye Galaxy and Aliens Ate my Babysitter.

It'll to be somewhat like the Patchwork Mods, with each participating member contributing a remix (or more than one if they want to) until all the tracks have been remixed. If you want to contribute, please either post in this topic or email me, and tell me which track you want to remix (to try and avoid having more than one person remix the same track).

I'll put who's doing which track on this list:

Commander Keen: Secret of the Oracle

Just Another Kick in The Pants in Good Old Hillville -
Too Hot! - ElecDude33 (finished)
Eat Your Veggies -
Slug Village -
Shadowlands -



Commander Keen: The Armageddon Machine

Be Spereful With My Diamonds -
Jazz Me -
Make it Tighter -
Security Center -
Wednesday on the Beach -
The Armageddon Machine -
Quantum Explosion Dynamo -
Gravitational Damping Hub -
Korath Fling (?) -
Game Over -
High Score Table -

Commander Keen: Aliens Ate My Babysitter

Aliens Ate my Babysitter -
Mamba Snake -
To the Future -
Eat at Joe's -
Guard Posts -
Bloogwater Crossing -
Bloogton Manufacturing -
Bloog Control Centre -
Bean With Bacon Megarocket/High Score Table -

(note: I might have missed some tracks or made some mistakes. Please inform me if so)------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Keen Community Remix Project
content: You're missing 2/3rds of the tunes, and I kinda doubt the community has enough musical talent to do this properly. Good luck, but pulling off even a small remix project is a major effort.

title: Re: Keen Community Remix Project
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Ogg Vorbis are better than stupid MP3.[hr][/quote]

Is this better as in "takes up less space with same or better sound quality" or "takes up tonnes more space for no difference that I can actually hear" (like FLAC etc.)?

I presume the former since I think they take up less space...

And you can use whatever file format you want as long as you tell people where they can find whatever plugins are needed (although I think Winamp can play OGGs without any plugins...).------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]

title: Re: Keen Community Remix Project
content:
It doesn't necessarily matter how much better OGG is over MP3. What does matter is that OGG is not an industry standard, where MP3 is. (As it has been around much longer.)

OGG isn't supported by most media players. (Or at least wasn't a few years back. Don't know about now though.) And besides, I don't think OGG is THAT much better than MP3. All in all they are about the same size, especially for a 2 - 5 minute song.

Besides, encoding music into a non-mainstream format and then putting it online for people to listen to is somewhat cruel and counter productive. A lot of people (like me) don't want unnecessary plugins or downloads cluttering up their hard drive and or registry. Most people won't bother listening to a song if a proprietary player is needed, which, defeats the whole point of making the music in the first place.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Keen Community Remix Project
content:
There isn't much difference between OGG and MP3, except the fact that OGG is an open format where MP3 is licensed. Since OGG is so free (as in free to do what you want with the format without nastly licenses attached), it should become a standard sometime. At least, that'd be the better deal for everyone. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

OGGs are supported by default on Linux where MP3 isn't because of the licenses, too. Though you can get MP3s running easily in Linux... (well, Ubuntu anyway.)____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].
